reviews.text:
Went on a school trip and had been told there would be 3 rooms for 5 people. Only an extra fold-up bed was added to one room and one ended up being for 4 and the hotel had to give and extra room to the group.
The buffet was not good and when asked for a soy milk cappuccino and told it could be done the manager used cow milk anyhow.
At the end of the stay we had requested to leave luggage at the hotel and were asked to pay an extra 3â‚¬ per person simply for it to be left in the main kitchen area unsupervised.
Would not recommend especially to a larger group of people but seeing the service I would not recommend in general.

Perfectly located a 5 minute walk from Torino Porta Nuova. The room was fine for the price and was nice to have a balcony too. Shower was lovely but could do with a shelf or something to put your toiletries on. Young guy really helpful and carried my enormous suitcase right to the room for me. Only downside, it would be better if you were told beforehand that you must pay for the water bottles they put in your room especially as you cannot drink the tap water. Great for a quick stop over.
I really liked this hotel. Great location, friendly staff and charming. The atmosphere is very nice. Also very electric car friendly. Stay here.
The hotel was old with broken fridge but the room was clean. I disappointed for the reason that they told us to pay extra money for leaving our luggages, because check out was until 11 pm.

The apartment I stayed was very small and the wooden floor creaked a bit. Shower was cold in the second day and water didn't warm up anymore. I saw a couple of mattresses outside the rooms in the corridor.
